title: Eminem has been performing and appearing in music videos as a rapper since he was a kid, but how come we didn't really hear of Eminem before his Infinite album and his song 'My Name Is…' came out? - Quora

response.answer_text: Why are all the hip hop questions on this site so idiotic?! Why didn’t you hear about Eminem before he released music nationally? Isn’t it obvious? He had no fucking music! Did you hear about Jay-Z rapping when he was 12? What about the guy round the corner from me who likes to MC? No? Its because they haven’t released anything at that point, so there’s nothing to hear. If you need to ask the internet to figure that out, you need to spend more time in school than thinking about hip hop music. Just goes to show who is listening to this once great music, and the reason it’s so easy for bullshit to be passed off as quality to these fans…smh.

Em was known on the underground battle circuit before any of his recorded material came out on Shady Aftermath. But most people aren't tapped into that world, so that's why most people never heard of him before that. Then he signed with Dr. Dre and boom. 0 to 100 REAL QUICK

Because you needed a big name player with plenty of street cred to get behind Em ,who nobody ever heard of ,and get people to give him a chance.Enter Dr Dre who saw he had real talent and gave Eminem a chance ,as well as himself a chance to make some cash as a finder’s fee.
